ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: YES, definitely! It's a great class and Lee선생님is just the cutest thing ever. Her enthusiasm will make you want to go to class even if it's at 9:25. The class is a bit harder than 110 just because the grammar gets more tricky but it's still a pretty fun class. Also, we get to have a taste of Korean food since the Lee선생님would bring us food occasionally and they are delicious. TAKEE IT!
I loved this class!! LEE SSN IS THE BOMB.
Basically a continuation of Korean 110. Angela Lee-Smith is still adorable, the food she brings to class is still delicious, and Mina still won't go on a date with Andy.
Pretty much your basic language course. The class will give you a pretty good grasp of the language.

I would definitely recommend KREN 120 with Professor Lee-Smith. You learn a lot and each class is interesting. Professor Lee-Smith makes learning Korean interesting. Be prepared to participate in class a lot, although everyone participates almost equally, so there is no pressure. It is a very low-stress environment and you learn how to communicate effectively.
If you're looking to take a new language and has no preference, take Korean! It's a relatively easy language, and the professor is great!

Korean 120 was something of an esteem boost compared to the first semester. I felt like my vocabulary became much more grounded and applicable, and grammar forms were readily integrated into classroom conversation. SSN Lee-Smith is one of those really special professors--she's lively and helpful, and loved to spoil us by bringing in homemade Korean food. The class has a great vibe, and the solidification of our language skills this semester allowed us to engage in enjoyable conversation. This class has a good amount of work, but you'll surely do well on exams if you keep up with the homework.
Korean 120 is a fun class that I would definitely recommend to another student.
If you have any interest in Korea whatsoever, do yourself a favor and take this class!! You absolutely won't regret it. It has been my favorite class at Yale, hands down.
